text: today I'm making tiramisu but not just
regular tiramisu I'm making a double
chocolate tiramisu my favorite kind of
jeremy's I'm breaking up 4 ounces of
chocolate into a quarter cup of heavy
cream start off by melting these two
together because it needs to cool before
I proceed with the rest of my recipe you
can melt them together in a double
boiler if you want to but you can also
use the microwave just take your
chocolate in your cream and then in 1
minute increments you just cook it stir
it cook it stir it until it's nice and
melted and combined melted and just stir
til it's fully combined and let it cool
just a little bit set it aside now take
2 tablespoons of unsweetened cocoa
powder and dissolve it in one and a half
cups of very hot water is what you're
going to soften your ladyfingers in so
if you wanted to add a little bit of
booze here you could maybe a little bit
of Kahlua would be nice or Grand Marnier
if you like a little bit of orange or
you can use the classic Marsala which i
think is what's usually used in it
tiramisu
that's your soaking liquid on them for
the base in my mixer I have an 8 ounce
package of cream cheese add 3/4 of a cup
of sugar and your cooled chocolate
mixture and then beat everything until
they're combined and smooth you're going
to add one and a quarter cups of heavy
cream to the mixture and let it beat
until it's flush
be careful when it first starts beating
it could splash because there's a lot of
liquid in there
keep it one scrape and then just beat it
until it's light and fluffy this seems
like on its own it would be kind of a
yummy cream cheese chocolate mousse I
would
so this is pretty soft right now but
remember that this goes into the
refrigerator and needs to set and the
cream cheese and the whipped cream will
all sort of set together and become a
little bit firmer okay have a 2 quart
baking dish already I have a nice cute
one right here and put about 1 and 1/3
cups or 1 cup depending on the size of
your pan or the shape of the chocolate
mixture into the bottom of the pan for
this one I need one in 2/3 cups spread
it out it's silky and amazing looking
now what you want to do is soak your
ladyfingers you have to wait until
you're assembling it to soak them
otherwise they'll be a little soft to
pick up so just take a lady finger just
dip it in lift it up and place it into
your pan you want to cover the top of
your mousse with ladyfingers you can
make your own ladyfingers if you want to
and we regress apiece for ladyfingers on
our website but these are store-bought
ladyfingers and they work really really
well here another layer of the mousse
mixture another one in the third cups
another layer of your soaked ladyfingers
depending on the pan you may get more or
less layers it mines a little bit of an
odd shape but it was so cute I wanted to
use it and then your final layer of
mousse every last drop cover the top
with your mousse refrigerate two hours
or up to overnight all set up and ready
to go dust a little bit of cocoa powder
over the top it adds just a hint of
chocolaty bitterness but also makes it
quite beautiful
now you're really ready to go
have a scoop beautiful layers of silky
mousse and soaked ladyfingers couldn't
be easier or more delicious this is one
elegant dessert
you
